If humans were able to photosynthesize, it would revolutionize the way we produce energy. We could harness the power of the sun and convert it into electricity, reducing our reliance on fossil fuels and mitigating the effects of climate change.
Humans could produce their own food, eliminating the need for agriculture and reducing the environmental impact of farming. This could lead to a more sustainable and efficient food production system.
Photosynthesis could be used to create new materials and products, such as biofuels, plastics, and textiles. This could lead to a more sustainable and eco-friendly economy.

Humans could potentially live in space without needing to bring their own food or oxygen, as they could produce it themselves. This could open up new possibilities for space exploration and colonization.

Photosynthesis could be used to create new forms of medicine and health supplements, as it is believed to have numerous health benefits. This could lead to a more natural and holistic approach to healthcare.
